title: Brilliant. I am blind developer needing emacspeak. Pulse Audio needs sorting for me to be able to use. Please please please!!
body: Native emacspeak rather than the poor cousin the port to windows would be great. Just need pulse audio sorted. emacspeak and emas installed and all fine, just no sound!! I want to remain on windows as it is the best accessible system but do need to access nix all the time so this would be super cool!

comments.body: Windows Speech API should be able to read WSL UI texts and vice versa.
Aseering has a ppa with a recompiled pulseaudio for WSL that connects with a local pulseaudio.

I tried to connect to pulseaudio server for windows, but anything. I tried jack also, but anything!  We need audio support on bash on windows, for emacspeak, but for other applications using audio: festvox, Mary tts, and more.
